title: Pressure Cooker Chili
subtitle: Hearty, no-bean chili with bold flavor
description: Alton Brown's pressure-cooked chili blends stew meat, salsa, spices, and beer for a rich, one-pot meal.

sections.content: Place the meat in a large mixing bowl and toss with the peanut oil and salt. Set aside.
Heat a 6-quart heavy-bottomed pressure cooker over high heat until hot. Add the meat in 3 or 4 batches and brown on all sides, approximately 2 minutes per batch. Transfer to a clean bowl.
Deglaze the pot with the beer, scraping browned bits from the bottom.
Return meat to pot. Add salsa, tortilla chips, chopped chipotle peppers, adobo sauce, tomato paste, chili powder, and cumin. Stir to combine.
Lock the lid and heat until steam starts hissing. Reduce heat to maintain a weak whistle and cook for 25 minutes.
Remove from heat, carefully release the steam, and serve immediately.

Prep: 15 min
Cook: 35 min
Total: 50 min

Course: Main
Cuisine: American
Servings: 4
Cost: Moderate
